config_description: /** * Database setting OPTIMIZE_IN_LIST (default: true). * Optimize IN(...) and IN(SELECT ...) comparisons. This includes * optimization for SELECT, DELETE, and UPDATE. */
developer_understanding_on_working: The OPTIMIZE_IN_LIST configuration setting is used to optimize the performance of IN(...) and IN(SELECT ...) comparisons in the code. When this setting is enabled, the code checks for this setting in the session's database settings and applies optimizations to the index conditions based on the value of this setting.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The OPTIMIZE_IN_LIST configuration is triggered whenever the createIndexConditions method is called in the code. The frequency of triggering depends on how often this method is invoked during the execution of the system.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: Enabling the OPTIMIZE_IN_LIST configuration can have a significant impact on the system's performance when dealing with queries that involve IN(...) and IN(SELECT ...) comparisons. By optimizing these comparisons, the system can potentially improve query execution times and overall efficiency.
